title: Socialist Party of America History and Geography - Mapping American Social Movements Project
snippet: Founded in 1901, the Socialist Party grew rapidly, claiming 113,000 members in 1912, making it, briefly, one of the largest socialist movements in the world. The SP won more than 900,000 votes in elections in 1912 and again in 1920. The movement's strength was evident also in the hundreds of ...

title: Socialist Party (Portugal) - Wikipedia
snippet: The Socialist Party (Portuguese: Partido Socialista [pɐɾˈtiðu susiɐˈliʃtɐ], PS) is a social democratic political party in Portugal. title: Socialist Party USA - Wikipedia
snippet: The Socialist Party of the United States of America (also Socialist Party USA or SPUSA) is a socialist political party in the United States. SPUSA formed in 1973, one year after the Socialist Party of America splintered into three: Social Democrats, ...

snippet: The Socialist Party of America was a United States political party that was founded in 1901. The party advocated for labor rights, social welfare, and political reform. Though the party never won any major elections, many of its ideas, such ...
